pr_title: CMTS-98: DeclarationSession is not failing when parameter values for …

timeline.bodyText: I just realized that I should first check if the parameterModel.isSupportExpression() == true before checking the String content.
timeline.author: gsfernandes

timeline.bodyText: Same here. I just realized that I should first check if the parameterModel.isSupportExpression() == true before checking the String content.
timeline.author: gsfernandes

timeline.message: CMTS-98: DeclarationSession is not failing when parameter values for values/metadata/sampleData have an expression

timeline.bodyText: Even if the parameterModel supportExpressions. Shouldn't we fail? I mean, we won't be able to process them anyways.
timeline.author: lucianoRM

replies.bodyText: Well, in that case the "value" is handled as String and it is up to the resolver to handle it. I added this in order to prevent doing the parsing of the String for each parameter as it has impact in performance.
replies.author: gsfernandes

timeline.author: lucianoRM
